result.execSummary:
The defendant Abdullah I Jasim was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Corrected to have 3 days credit added

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement 

Court will not expunge this case.

8:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Abdullah I Jasim in court.  Attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos Jr in court for Abdullah I Jasim. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Matter set for a jury status date but the matter is resolved. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: GUILTY. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
6 months Racine County Jail imposed and stayed. 
1 year probation.

Conditions of probation:
60 days Racine County Jail STAYED
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored accordingly. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Court will not expunge this case.

copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

***ALSO $1,250.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Abdullah I Jasim appeared by video, in custody, Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Abdullah I Jasim. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
